DOC.brief_title: A Randomized Trial External Beam Radiotherapy Versus Cryoablation Patients With Localized Prostate Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Men newly diagnose localized prostate cancer randomly assign cryoablation external beam radiotherapy ( median dose 68 Gy ) . All patient receive neoadjuvant antiandrogen therapy . The primary endpoint disease progression 36 month base trifecta definition failure : ( ) radiological evidence metastatic disease b ) initiation antineoplastic therapy c ) biochemical failure ) . Two definition biochemical failure use : 1 ) rise PSA final value > 1.0 ng/mL 2 ) rise PSA nadir + 2 ng/mL . Secondary endpoint overall survival , disease-specific survival , positive prostate biopsy 36 month .
DOC.criteria: Clinically localized prostate cancer PSA < 20ng/ml Negative bone scan Previous TURP Previous hormone therapy
